precondition: The Windows XP desktop is displayed with the Start button in the bottom left corner and the system tray in the bottom right corner.
action: Click the mouse on an empty space on the desktop.
expected_results: No immediate visual change is expected.

precondition: The Windows XP desktop is visible.
expected_results: The Start Menu will open, displaying options such as 'My Documents', 'My Computer', 'Control Panel', and 'All Programs'.

precondition: The Windows XP desktop is visible.
expected_results: The 'Control Panel' window will open in the center of the screen.

precondition: The Windows XP desktop is visible.
expected_results: The 'Start' menu will open, displaying options such as 'My Computer', 'Control Panel', and 'Printers and Faxes'.

precondition: The Windows XP Start Menu is open with the mouse cursor hovering over the 'Control Panel' option. The 'Control Panel' option is highlighted.
expected_results: The Windows XP Control Panel window will open, covering the Start Menu. The Control Panel will display a list of categories.

precondition: The Windows XP Control Panel is displaying in Category View with the 'Switch to Classic View' link visible in the navigation pane.
action: Click the 'Switch to Classic View' link in the Control Panel navigation pane.
expected_results: The Control Panel should switch to Classic View, displaying all available control panel icons.

precondition: The Windows XP Control Panel is open in Classic View.
expected_results: The active selection may change, visually indicated by a highlighted icon.

precondition: The Control Panel is open in Classic View, displaying system setting icons.
The Windows XP Control Panel window is open.
action: Press the 'p' key followed by the 'o' key.
expected_results: The mouse cursor will move to hover over the "Taskbar and Start Menu" icon.

precondition: The "Power Options" icon in the Windows XP Control Panel is highlighted.
expected_results: The "Power Options Properties" window will open, displaying the selected power scheme settings.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Home/Office Desk" power scheme is selected.
action: Click the dropdown menu labeled "Turn off hard disks".
expected_results: A list of time interval options will appear, allowing you to choose when to automatically turn off the hard disks.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" dialog box is open with the "Power Schemes" tab selected. The "Turn off hard disks" dropdown menu is expanded.
action: Click the "Never" option within the "Turn off hard disks" dropdown menu.
expected_results: The "Turn off hard disks" dropdown menu will close. The selected power-off setting will be applied.

precondition: The 'Power Options Properties' window is open. The desired power settings are configured.
expected_results: The 'Power Options Properties' window will close. The changes to the power settings will be saved.

precondition: The Windows XP Control Panel window is open.
The 'Display Properties' window is open and the 'Screen Saver' tab is active.
expected_results: A dropdown menu will appear, displaying a list of available screensavers.

precondition: The 'Display Properties' window is open and the 'Screen Saver' tab is selected. The 'Screen Saver' dropdown menu should display 'Windows XP' as the currently selected option.
action: Click the dropdown arrow on the 'Screen Saver' dropdown menu.
expected_results: A list of available screensavers will appear, with '[None]' becoming the new selected option in the 'Screen Saver' dropdown menu.

precondition: The "Screen Saver" tab of the "Display Properties" window is open. The "Screen saver" dropdown menu is visible.
action: Click the "3D FlowerBox" option in the "Screen saver" dropdown menu.
expected_results: The "Wait" time will change to "10" minutes, and the "On resume, password protect" checkbox will become enabled.

precondition: The 'Display Properties' window is open, with the 'Screen Saver' tab selected.
action: Click the 'OK' button at the bottom of the 'Display Properties' window.

precondition: The Control Panel window is open.
action: Click the close button (X) in the top right corner of the Control Panel window.
expected_results: The Control Panel window will close.
